meanings.sent1: After receiving the products, she decided to reexport them to a different market.
meanings.sent2: The company will reexport the goods to meet the demand in other countries.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally reexported the same items twice, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The idea to reexport the knowledge gained from the workshop spread quickly among the team.
meanings.sent5: The decision to reexport the technology proved to be a smart move for the business.

meanings.definition: The act of exporting goods or services to another country after they have been imported.
meanings.sent1: The reexport of the products was necessary to fulfill international orders.
meanings.sent2: Global trade relies on the reexport of various goods to different regions.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected increase in reexports surprised the economists.
meanings.sent4: The company's success was partly due to its strategic reexport of resources.
meanings.sent5: The government encouraged the reexport of surplus crops to support neighboring countries.
